summary: Just an ENB preset I made for my own usage that I thought I should share.
descriptionHtml:
Just an ENB preset I made for my own usage that I thought I should share.

[heading][color=yellow]Details[/color][/heading]
It currently features the following ENB effects:
Bloom (including lens effects)
Adaption
AmbientOcclusion
DetailedShadow
SunRays

You can however enable Bokeh Depth of Field in the ini by simply changing \"EnableDepthOfField=false\" to \"EnableDepthOfField=true\".
It\'s disabled as I don\'t like the effect in third person view, looked great to me in first person though so test it out if you want.


[heading][color=yellow]Installation[/color][/heading]
- Firstly you need [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0119.htm]ENBSeries v0.119 for TES Skyrim [/url] and install it first.
- Then place the content of the .7z file in your Skyrim installation folder.


[heading][color=yellow]Uninstall[/color][/heading]
Delete the files
../Skyrim/enbbloom.fx
../Skyrim/enbeffect.fx
../Skyrim/enbeffectprepass.fx
../Skyrim/enbpalette.bmp
../Skyrim/enbseries.ini
../Skyrim/enbsunsprite.fx
../Skyrim/enbsunsprite.tga


[heading][color=yellow]Incompatibility[/color][/heading]
Every other ENB Preset.


[heading][color=yellow]Known Bugs[/color][/heading]
None currently known


[heading][color=yellow]Credits[/color][/heading]
Bethesda for the game
Boris Vorontsov for the ENB series
Matso for the Depth of Field effects


[heading][color=yellow]Tools Used[/color][/heading]
Notepad++


[heading][color=yellow]Licensing/Legal[/color][/heading]
You can use the file however you like just remember to give credits where due.
author: ErikRedbeard

files.name: Redbeards ENB Preset 1-1
files.changelogHtml: Changed the Adaption Max Value from 2.0 to 1.8
